title: Help me be less toxic please.
body:
Hi, just got a 15-day suspension for being toxic which I'll definitely admit to being, I've sent an appeal to Riot Games asking for a permanent chat ban instead of a 15 day suspension in the hopes that I don't miss out on valuable limited time playing with my friends who live far away.

My main point here is, can anyone help me be less toxic? I just can't help it, I don't know what the root of it is, but even muting players doesn't work for me. I've been playing since 2012 and have never been as toxic as I am in 2017, can anyone try and give me some tips or something to do to help out, I just don't have the patience or mental fortitude to hold myself back.

Probably posting this in the wrong section or it's just a dumb question, thanks anyway!

 {{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}}

replies.body: I think you're actually a genius!
Hmm... I might actually do this myself :D

Just learn to talk aloud rather than type :) 

I find if you just say it aloud instead of typing it, you might not even wanna say the things you type after hearing how terrible it comes out :P

Just laugh a play or a msg in chat rather than flame the person back. Another thing is to lighten to mood by memeing a lil :)

This is the advice that I personally tend to follow! Letting it out in a different context can help to relieve the tension that can come from the rough games. 

Another way, (which appeals to my own sense of self interest) is to think of your chat as a tool to help you win the game.  Basically, before you send a message think "Does this actually improve my chances of winning the game?". Naturally, things that tend to pass this check involve tactical things as well as keeping your team on the positive side. 

This is a pretty mercantile way of thinking about things - but it tends to help me focus better on the right things to say in chat.

I dont mute people, in fact I read all their chat so I have evidence when I report them.

I just love reporting people, I dont say anything, I report them and provide them a chance to be banned. I report at least 5 per day, i only report verbal abuse and bots, never report for feeding.

WINK

I'm similar to you. I don't like muting people. I'll report them after the game, but I don't like muting them. What I do is I rage *out loud*. Riot won't know, and can't ban you, plus it's much more satisfying. Also I like Easley's idea...
Don't blame you, both the game and the community has gone downhill over the last few years and it's showing no sign of stoping.

Dude just quit game it's trash now and OCE is in worse state it ever has been! It was nice when we first got our servers and gradually it has become an absolute dissapointment and RIOT only cares if you say one bad word here or there like thats the end of the world to them they dont care about botters that have been going on for 3+ years now or trolls or afk nothing of the sort but OMG say FML in one game and get a 20 game chat ban
